RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 20000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR THREE YEAR OLDS. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 8 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DUKE OF BLUE RIDGE set the pace in the two path, drew clear while well in hand around the far turn, inched further away under driving pressure in upper stretch, and was put to wraps late. DUDE DROP KID stalked along the inside, shifted to the two path entering the backstretch, gained place before tipping to the three path and outside of the clear leader turning for home, then chased that rival through the lane while pulling clear of the rest. OLDER AND WISER leaned outwardly at the start, saved ground off of the pace, then moved up along the rail. CHIEF KIMOSABI tracked four wide around both turns, and gave way. PUTTHEHAMMERDOWN trailed in the three path, and made little impact. CATINANDSCATIN stalked outside of the pace setter and from the three path, but weakened between horses around the far turn, and was eased through the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Older and Wiser
ENTRY.COMMENT: leaned out start, off pace inside, saved ground, moved up

ENTRY.NAME: Duke of Blue Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 2p,clear in hand 2nd,driven/inched away upr,wraps late

ENTRY.NAME: Dude Drop Kid
ENTRY.OWNER: Charles C. and John Dirik, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked ins, 2p3/4, took aim 2w-3p1/4, chased, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Putthehammerdown
ENTRY.COMMENT: at rear 3p, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Catinandscatin
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2wd-3pth, wknd btwn 2nd, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Chief Kimosabi
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 4wd, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Claiming Purse 24000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRINCE OF GLORY trailed in the three path, swung out entering the lane, drifted to the eight path at the three sixteenths pole, then rallied down the center of the track to drive past the leaders in the closing stages. ROCK WITH YOU brushed an inner rival leaving the gates, dueled for the lead two wide, inched clear nearing the lane, held sway from chasers through midstretch, but was caught by an outer oncharging rival in the final sixteenth. CELLULOID HERO stalked the embattled leading pair from the outside, took aim on the leader in upper stretch, but only managed to chase that foe through the lane, and was outkicked for place late. KISLOVODSK laid off of the pace along the inside, then chased along the rail through the lane while lacking the needed kick to produce a bid. FASTNFURIOUS chased in the three to four paths around the turn, attempted to range up outside of the leaders turning for home, but tired in upper stretch without menacing. JUSTFORSPEIGHTOFIT brushed with an outer rival at the start, sparred for the lead inside of that foe into the turn, but weakened approaching the five sixteenths pole, and was eased through the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Justforspeightofit
ENTRY.OWNER: Oh Happy Days Stable Crabtree Steve and KMR Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed start, dueled inside, wknd 5/16, eased late

ENTRY.NAME: Rock With You
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush start,dueled 2wd,led 5/16,inchd clear,held sway,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Celluloid Hero
ENTRY.OWNER: Mentz, John and Robertson, Hugh H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pair 3wd, took aim upper, chased, outkicked late

ENTRY.NAME: Kislovodsk
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside, rail chase, lacked bid

ENTRY.NAME: Fastnfurious
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-4p, inched closer 5/16, tired upper

ENTRY.NAME: Prince of Glory
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed 3p, 5wd upr, 8p3/16, rallied, late bid, drove past

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 20000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR THREE YEAR OLDS. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 8 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EASY RUNNER brushed the outer part of the gate while breaking a step slowly, prompted the pace three wide, vied into the turn, drew clear in hand nearing the lane, shifted to the five path at the quarter pole, and drew off under moderate hand urging thereafter. CHROMPTON chased along the inside, split foes three wide in upper stretch to bid for place at the furlong grounds inside of MR ELVIN, then battled with that foe through the late stages, and prevailed. MR ELVIN tracked two wide and between horses, shifted to the four path and outside of the leader nearing the five sixteenths pole, but failed to keep pace with that one while bidding for place entering the lane, gained that position before meeting CHROMPTON's inner challenge in midstretch, dueled with that one through the final furlong, but was outfinished. OLE STUD MUFFIN chased while off of the pace and outside of rivals, got floated to the five path around the turn, fanned to the six path entering the lane, and gave way. MAGIC LIGHTNING sparred for the lead two wide and between horses into the turn, but proved no match for his outer counterpart turning for home, and yielded in upper stretch. REVERENT dueled for the lead inside of a pair of foes, but weakened leaving the three furlong pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Chrompton
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, split foes 3wd upper, bid place, vied, prevaied

ENTRY.NAME: Reverent
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside pair, wknd 3/8

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Elvin
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2wd btwn, 4p5/16, place bid 1/4, vied, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Ole Stud Muffin
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased off pace 3wd, 5p5/16, 6p1/4, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Lightning
ENTRY.COMMENT: sparred 2wd btwn, no match 5/16, yielded upper

ENTRY.NAME: Easy Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushd gate/step slow st,prompt 3wd,cleard 5/16,5p1/4,ridden out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES OVER A MILE SINCE JULY 8, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 8 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility And Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IMINDYCATBIRDSEAT tracked in the four to six path and outside of rivals around the first turn, inched closer to stalk the top pair from the five path into the far turn, bid outside of a leading OAK HILL SOLUTION in upper stretch, dueled through midstretch, and edged ahead in the final sixteenth. OAK HILL SOLUTION stalked outside of the leader and in the four path, pressed down the backstretch, vied around the far turn, led with a quarter mile to go as an outer IMINDYCATBIRDSEAT loomed a danger, met that one's challenge in upper stretch, dueled well into the final furlong, but was bested in the closing stages. PRAY IDE SING broke through the gate pre-race, but was quickly reloaded, set the pace while remaining multiple lengths off the inside as an outer rival pressed, got headed by that foe at the quarter pole, yielded in upper stretch, yet lasted for show between horses late. LOUISIANA MOON laid off of the pace in the three path, tracked the main group around the far turn, shifted to the five, then six, path entering the lane, but lacked a bid. I'M D'CAT was coaxed along while tracking along the inside, vacated the rail in upper stretch, then failed to menace between horses. WICKED ALEX was a bit antsy in the starting gate, trailed along the inside early on, swung from the three path to the seven entering the lane, and failed to factor. MY GUITAR stalked behind the leading pair and from the two path early on, shifted to the five path and outside of them entering the backstretch, but came under coaxing while tucking to the rail nearing the far turn, chased around that bend, but gave way through the lane. CAEUS IN PASADENA broke a step slowly, raced at the rear in the four to five paths, and got outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: I'm d'Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, coaxed along, 2wd upper, no meance btw

ENTRY.NAME: Pray Ide Sing
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke thru gate,set pace ins foe-3p,headed 1/4,yielded,lastd show

ENTRY.NAME: My Guitar
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2p, 3wd-5p3/4, chased ins2nd, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Alex
ENTRY.COMMENT: antsy gate, trailed ins, 3p2nd, 7p3/16, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Oak Hill Solution
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w-4p,pressed,vied,led 1/4,dug in upr,dueled,bested late

ENTRY.NAME: Caeus in Pasadena
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow start, at rear 4-5p, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Louisiana Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p, tracked 2nd, 5-6p3/16, lacked bid

ENTRY.NAME: Imindycatbirdseat
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 4-6p1st,stalked 3w-5p2nd,bid upr,dueled,edged ahead late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 22000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR FOUR YEAR OLDS. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 8 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUR FREDDIE MAC vied for the lead three to two wide, drew clear at the five sixteenths pole, and held sway from a chasing rival through the final furlong. BIG SCULLY laid close up between the pace setting pair early on, failed to keep pace at the half mile pole, stalked them from the three path around the bend, took aim outside of the clearing leader in upper stretch, but steadily drifted out while chasing well through the final furlong. TWO B broke slowly, quickly rushed forward to duel for the lead inside of the eventual winner, but proved no match at the five sixteenths pole, and tired while hanging on his left lead. FOOLISH DREAMS settled off of the pace in the two wide, then improved inside of rivals while being herded inwardly coming to midstretch. ITELLYOUTHEFACTS chased from midpack in the three to four paths around the turn, then lacked a rally between horses. QUARTER RAT spotted the leaders over a length while off slow at the start, lacked speed in the three path, fanned to the six path entering the lane, and lacked a rally. CHARLIE'S TOWN pursued from midpack while hung in the five path around the turn, then drifted inwardly approaching midstretch while giving way. BAQUERO'S BIND was outrun in the two path.

ENTRY.NAME: Two B
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow start, rushed, dueled ins, no match 5/16, tired, left lead

ENTRY.NAME: Big Scully
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up 2wbtw,stalk 1/2,3p turn,aim upr,drifted out,chased well

ENTRY.NAME: Itellyouthefacts
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased midpack 3-4p, lacked rally btwn

ENTRY.NAME: Baquero's Bind
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun 2p

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie's Town
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack 5p, drifted in upper, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Foolish Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 2p, improved / floated in upper

ENTRY.NAME: Our Freddie Mac
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 3-2wd, drew clear 5/16, held sway, driving

ENTRY.NAME: Quarter Rat
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow start, off pace 2w-3p, 6p1/4, no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 53000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 8 Allowed 3 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PACIFICISLANDTIME took a mild bump from an inner rival at the start, was contempt to trail behind fast fractions down the backstretch, rallied in the five path around the far turn, sustained his charge to bid at the furlong grounds, and drove clear. DRILLING REPORT tracked in the three path, gained in the four path to bid for the lead nearing the lane, drew clear in upper stretch, but was outkicked by an outer rival at the furlong grounds, and proved second best. DREWHUSTLE stalked the run away leaders from the two path, inched closer to the remaining pace setter around the far turn as an outer rival did the same, got outmoved by that foe nearing the lane, yet kept on to secure a minor placing. BIND FAITH was bumped by an inner foe into an outer rival at the start, tracked along the inside, chased from the fence around the far turn, and lacked a bid. COHERE laid off of the pace in the four path, came into the lane wider, and failed to factor. INTO WISHING settled off of the pace two wide, and made little impact. EVERLOVINGHAND broke out and bumped a rival at the start, dueled for the lead inside of AND FIFTY while setting strenuous fractions, inherited a clear margin after his counterpart stopped at the half mile pole, but was overhauled by bidders entering the lane, and weakened. AND FIFTY sparred for the lead two wide through a arduous pace, but was through before reaching the half mile pole, stopped around the far turn, and was eased through the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Everlovinghand
ENTRY.OWNER: Alexis Claire Racing Services LLC and Pohl Dennis
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out/bump st,hard duel ins,clear 1/2,overhauled 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Bind Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped btwn start, tracked inside, chased 2nd, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Pacificislandtime
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, trailed, rallied 5p2nd, bid 1/8, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Drilling Report
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3p, gained 4p2nd, bid 5/16, cleared upper, outkicked 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Drewhustle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2p, chased/outmoved 3p5/16, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Into Wishing
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 2wd, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: And Fifty
ENTRY.OWNER: Hernandez Earl J Hernandez Keith J and Duvieilh John
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard duel 2wd, wknd 1/2, stopped, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Cohere
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4p, no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 51000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, WAIVER CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since Novemb er 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $40,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $40,000 In Their Last 3 Starts). (If deemed inadvisable by managemen t to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 34 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FREEDOM'S WAY tracked in the three path around the first turn, inched closer along the inside approaching the far turn, split the leading pair two wide to bid entering the far turn, vied with his outer rival turning for home, yet kicked clear entering the lane, and was driven home. SUPER WISE stalked outside of the pace setter, but left ample room for FREEDOM'S WAY to bid between them while ranging up entering the far turn, vied with that one turning for home, but failed to keep pace entering the lane, and chased that foe home to prove second best. FIELDSTONE laid off of the pace in the four path, tracked the newly leading pair around the far turn, but only managed to chase them through the lane. WIN WORTHY walked out of the starting gates and spotted the rest multiple lengths, lagged behind in the three path, swung to t he seven path entering the lane, and surpassed a tired rival. WILTON set a clear pace entering the backstretch, but was headed by a pair of bidders at the three furlong pole, and weakened turning for home.

ENTRY.NAME: Wilton
ENTRY.COMMENT: set clear pace, headed ins pair 3/8, wknd 5/16

ENTRY.NAME: Win Worthy
ENTRY.COMMENT: very slow start, lagged behind 3p, 7p upr, passed tired

ENTRY.NAME: Super Wise
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2wd, outmoved/bid 3w7/16, vied, outpaced 1/4, chased

ENTRY.NAME: Fieldstone
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4p, tracked 2nd, chased

ENTRY.NAME: Freedom's Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Snyder Richard Snyder Connie and Werner William K
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins-3p, split leaders/bid 2wd btw7/16, drew clear 1/4

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CIGAR VAN pressed the leader from the three path, vied around the turn, drew clear in the six path leaving the quarter pole, widened his margin after shifting further out at the furlong pole, and was put to wraps late. AUTUMN'S SO FLASHY trailed in the four path into the turn, fanned to the center of the track in upper stretch, and stayed on while hanging on his left lead to reach place late. HAPPY SEASON was floated inwardly at the start, chased along the inside, pursued the top pair from the three path around the turn, took aim on the leader from the seven path in upper stretch, but failed to progress coming to midstretch, lugged in slightly while flattening out at the furlong grounds, and was outkicked for place late. GRAY DANE laid off of the pace in the two path, then chased mildly along the rail. STARPORT set the pace inside of the eventual winner while a path off of the inside, got headed by that foe nearing the lane, failed to keep pace in upper stretch, and yielded between horses in the final furlong. ALL OUT WAR raced far back along the inside, and never got involved. LINCOLN PRODUCTION chased in the four path, and faded. PUNCHIE was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Season
ENTRY.COMMENT: floated in st,chasd ins,3p turn,aim 7p upr,chasd,lug/flattend 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Starport
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace,ins winner-2p turn,headed 5/16,outpaced upr,yield btw1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Cigar Van
ENTRY.OWNER: Pitzer Renee and Berggren Wayne J
ENTRY.COMMENT: press 2w-3p,vied turn,led 5/16,cleared 6p upr,drew off,wraps late

ENTRY.NAME: Autumn's So Flashy
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed 4p, 11p upr, stayed on, left lead, up place late

ENTRY.NAME: Lincoln Production
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4p, faded

ENTRY.NAME: All Out War
ENTRY.COMMENT: far back inside, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Punchie
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Gray Dane
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 2p, rail chase
